subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: Howard Schultz, the former owner of the Seattle SuperSonics, said he was warned by N.B.A. Commissioner David Stern that it would be “very expensive” to pursue a lawsuit seeking to return the team to Seattle from Oklahoma City. Schultz made the claim in a declaration filed Thursday in United States District Court in Seattle. He has sued to try to reverse his sale of the franchise to Clay Bennett, an Oklahoma City businessman, asserting that Bennett failed to negotiate in good faith to keep the team in Seattle.
